rhythm.selectInitial: Select initial rhythm to begin ACLS protocol

rhythmCheckModal.title: RHYTHM CHECK
rhythmCheckModal.subtitle: Pause CPR briefly. Analyze rhythm. Check pulse.

hsTs.title: H's & T's - Reversible Causes
hsTs.hypovolemiaDiagnostic: Look for hemorrhage/volume loss clues; check Hb/Hct and ABG/VBG (including lactate) if available. Use POCUS (IVC/ventricular size) and FAST in trauma/suspected bleeding.
hsTs.hypovolemiaManagement: Control bleeding (e.g., tourniquet/pelvic binder when appropriate) and start rapid volume replacement - blood products when hemorrhage is likely, otherwise IV fluids.
hsTs.hypoxiaDiagnostic: Use waveform capnography, SpO‚ÇÇ trend, and ventilatory mechanics; obtain ABG/VBG if feasible without delaying critical actions.
hsTs.hypoxiaManagement: Fix oxygenation/ventilation immediately - optimize BVM, clear obstruction, secure advanced airway when needed, and deliver high-concentration oxygen with appropriate ventilation rate.
hsTs.hydrogenIonDiagnostic: ABG/VBG for pH/lactate and context (e.g., prolonged downtime, poor ventilation, sepsis, DKA).
hsTs.hydrogenIonManagement: Optimize ventilation and perfusion (avoid hyperventilation; ensure high-quality compressions) and treat the underlying cause; sodium bicarbonate is generally reserved for specific indications per local protocol (commonly including hyperkalemia/TCA overdose).
hsTs.hypoHyperkalemiaDiagnostic: Point-of-care electrolytes (often via blood gas analyzer) plus ECG pattern recognition.
hsTs.hypoHyperkalemiaManagement: If hyperkalemia suspected/confirmed, give IV calcium and shift potassium with insulin/glucose (¬± bicarbonate as adjunct) and arrange definitive removal (e.g., dialysis) when relevant/available. If hypokalemia is the concern, replace potassium after circulation is present/returning (post-ROSC) and correct contributing causes.
hsTs.hypothermiaDiagnostic: Measure core temperature (esophageal probe preferred if intubated) and check ABG/electrolytes to guide complications.
hsTs.hypothermiaManagement: Start active rewarming (warmed fluids/forced-air warming) and consider ECLS/ECMO rewarming pathways for severe hypothermic arrest where available, while continuing standard resuscitation.
hsTs.tensionPneumoDiagnostic: Clinical clues (unilateral breath sounds, high airway pressures, sudden decompensation - especially if ventilated) and lung POCUS (e.g., absent lung sliding).
hsTs.tensionPneumoManagement: Immediate decompression without waiting for imaging (needle decompression) followed by definitive thoracostomy/chest drain ASAP.
hsTs.tamponadeDiagnostic: Cardiac POCUS for pericardial effusion and supportive signs (e.g., plethoric IVC).
hsTs.tamponadeManagement: Emergent pericardiocentesis (POCUS-guided if possible) or resuscitative thoracotomy in select traumatic arrest scenarios.
hsTs.toxinsDiagnostic: Rapid collateral history (medications/exposures), targeted exam, and basic labs (including electrolytes and temperature) to narrow likely toxidromes.
hsTs.toxinsManagement: Supportive care plus targeted antidotes/reversal agents when indicated, with early toxicology/poison-center guidance.
hsTs.thrombosisPulmDiagnostic: Persistently low ETCO‚ÇÇ despite good CPR can support suspicion, and POCUS may show RV strain (¬± DVT scan if it won't prolong pauses).
hsTs.thrombosisPulmManagement: If PE is strongly suspected/known, consider thrombolysis or embolectomy pathways per local capability; prolonged CPR after thrombolysis may be appropriate before termination decisions.
hsTs.thrombosisCoroDiagnostic: Clues include VF/pVT presentation and ischemic prodrome; confirm post-ROSC with 12‚Äëlead ECG (e.g., STEMI).
hsTs.thrombosisCoroManagement: After ROSC with STEMI, prioritize urgent coronary angiography/PCI based on system pathways.

pregnancy.title: Pregnancy - Obstetric Arrest
pregnancy.tapToActivate: Tap to activate if pregnant patient
pregnancy.cannotDeactivate: Protocol cannot be deactivated once started
pregnancy.emergencyDeliveryDesc: Resuscitative hysterotomy should ideally be performed by 5 minutes if no ROSC, when fundal height is at or above umbilicus
pregnancy.leftUterineDesc: Use two hands to relieve aortocaval compression and facilitate effective chest compressions
pregnancy.earlyAirwayDesc: Difficult airway is common in pregnancy - use most experienced provider
pregnancy.ivAboveDesc: Place IV access above the diaphragm
pregnancy.stopMagnesiumDesc: If receiving IV magnesium, stop immediately and give calcium
pregnancy.massiveTransfusionDesc: Activate if amniotic fluid embolism suspected
pregnancy.bleedingDesc: Postpartum hemorrhage, placental abruption, uterine rupture

history.title: Session History
history.startNew: Start a new code and save it to see your session history here.
history.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this session?

install.title: Install App
install.subtitle: Add ResusBuddy to your home screen for instant access
install.iosNote: Must use Safari browser - Chrome/Firefox won't work on iOS
install.iosStep1Desc: Find the share icon (square with arrow) at the bottom of Safari
install.iosStep2Desc: Scroll down and tap "Add to Home Screen"
install.iosStep3Desc: Tap "Add" in the top right corner
install.androidStep1Desc: Tap the three dots (‚ãÆ) in the top right corner of Chrome
install.androidStep2Desc: Tap "Install app" or "Add to Home screen"
install.benefit1: Works offline - no internet required during codes
install.footer: The app updates automatically when connected to the internet

about.title: Info
about.disclaimerEducational: This app is intended solely for educational and training purposes in simulations
about.disclaimerNotReal: Do not use on real patients - always follow local protocols and clinical judgment
about.disclaimerResponsibility: The user is solely responsible for clinical decisions made during real resuscitations
about.usageLocalData: All data saved locally on your device only
about.referencesAHA: Based on AHA 2025 Adult (ACLS) and Pediatric (PALS) Cardiac Arrest Algorithms
about.shareDesc: Share this app with colleagues for training
about.shareText: Check out ResusBuddy - an ACLS training app!
